summary: This document is email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a witness tracking spreadsheet for the Epstein case. It discusses organizing witness materials, marking some folders as 'not a witness,' and planning to gather e-communications from case agents for future production.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist at U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Sent the initial witness tracking spreadsheet and saved it on a shared location.

events.title: Email exchange about witness spreadsheet
events.description: Email correspondence discussing updates to a witness tracking spreadsheet and plans for handling witness materials and e-communications.

events.title: Initial witness spreadsheet distribution
events.description: Paralegal Specialist sent the witness tracking spreadsheet with columns to designate witness types.

locations.context: Address of the United States Attorney's Office mentioned in the email signature.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office maintained a detailed witness tracking spreadsheet for the Epstein case with columns to designate witness types.
Some folders were marked 'not a witness' and needed to be moved for review and potential production outside the context of 3500 materials.
The office planned to contact case agents to gather e-communications with witnesses for future disclosure as part of 3500 productions.
The correspondence shows organized preparation for witness material management and disclosure in the legal proceedings.
